name: tangentially
content:
tangentially adverb
(INDIRECTLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is different from or not directly connected with something that you were talking about or doing before: tangentially related I did not arrange this meeting, and it's only tangentially related to my job. He was tangentially linked to a group of religious fundamentalists.
More examplesFewer examplesSome of the protests are only tangentially related to the event. She told them that she was only tangentially involved in decisions about redundancies.Some of these witnesses are only tangentially connected to the case.

Irrelevant
tangentially adverb
(OF TANGENT)
mathematics, science
  specialized in a way that is along a tangent: The sample was flattened with a microscope slide and sectioned tangentially. It is located at the periphery and oriented tangentially to the cell surface.
